channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: AnthroNet: Conditional Generation of Humans via Anthropometrics
item.description: We present a novel human body model formulated by an extensive set of anthropocentric measurements, which is capable of generating a wide range of human body shapes and poses.

item.title: AnthroNet: Conditional Generation of Humans via Anthropometrics
item.description: We present a novel human body model formulated by an extensive set of anthropocentric measurements, which is capable of generating a wide range of human body shapes and poses.

item.title: Context-Aware 3D Object Localization from Single Calibrated Images: A Study of Basketballs
item.description: Accurately localizing objects in three dimensions (3D) is crucial for various computer vision applications, such as robotics, autonomous driving, and augmented reality.

item.title: ResFields: Residual Neural Fields for Spatiotemporal Signals
item.description: Neural fields, a category of neural networks trained to represent high-frequency signals, have gained significant attention in recent years due to their impressive performance in modeling complex 3D data, especially large neural signed distance (SDFs) or radiance fields (NeRFs) via a single multi-layer perceptron (MLP).

item.title: Simulating room transfer functions between transducers mounted on audio devices using a modified image source method
item.description: The image source method (ISM) is often used to simulate room acoustics due to its ease of use and computational efficiency.

item.title: Privacy-preserving Continual Federated Clustering via Adaptive Resonance Theory
item.description: In the clustering domain, various algorithms with a federated learning framework (i. e., federated clustering) have been actively studied and showed high clustering performance while preserving data privacy.

item.title: Learning to Recharge: UAV Coverage Path Planning through Deep Reinforcement Learning
item.description: Coverage path planning (CPP) is a critical problem in robotics, where the goal is to find an efficient path that covers every point in an area of interest.

item.title: GPT-InvestAR: Enhancing Stock Investment Strategies through Annual Report Analysis with Large Language Models
item.description: This paper aims to simplify the process of assessing Annual Reports of all the firms by leveraging the capabilities of Large Language Models (LLMs).

item.title: Aligning Large Language Models for Clinical Tasks
item.description: Large Language Models (LLMs) have demonstrated remarkable adaptability, showcasing their capacity to excel in tasks for which they were not explicitly trained.

item.title: ResFields: Residual Neural Fields for Spatiotemporal Signals
item.description: Neural fields, a category of neural networks trained to represent high-frequency signals, have gained significant attention in recent years due to their impressive performance in modeling complex 3D data, especially large neural signed distance (SDFs) or radiance fields (NeRFs) via a single multi-layer perceptron (MLP).

item.title: Symmetric-Reciprocal-Match Method for Vector Network Analyzer Calibration
item.description: The method involves using multiple symmetric one-port loads, a two-port reciprocal device, and a matched load.

item.title: SeisCLIP: A seismology foundation model pre-trained by multi-modal data for multi-purpose seismic feature extraction
item.description: Training specific deep learning models for particular tasks is common across various domains within seismology.

item.title: Anatomy-Driven Pathology Detection on Chest X-rays
item.description: Pathology detection and delineation enables the automatic interpretation of medical scans such as chest X-rays while providing a high level of explainability to support radiologists in making informed decisions.

item.title: A Lightweight, Rapid and Efficient Deep Convolutional Network for Chest X-Ray Tuberculosis Detection
item.description: In this work, we propose LightTBNet, a novel lightweight, fast and efficient deep convolutional network specially customized to detect TB from CXR images.

item.title: Data Aggregation for Hierarchical Clustering
item.description: Hierarchical Agglomerative Clustering (HAC) is likely the earliest and most flexible clustering method, because it can be used with many distances, similarities, and various linkage strategies.

item.title: SyntheWorld: A Large-Scale Synthetic Dataset for Land Cover Mapping and Building Change Detection
item.description: However, when it comes to remote sensing image processing, the creation of synthetic datasets becomes challenging due to the demand for larger-scale and more diverse 3D models.

item.title: Revisiting File Context for Source Code Summarization
item.description: Source code summarization is the task of writing natural language descriptions of source code.

item.title: Doppelgangers: Learning to Disambiguate Images of Similar Structures
item.description: Our evaluation shows that our method can distinguish illusory matches in difficult cases, and can be integrated into SfM pipelines to produce correct, disambiguated 3D reconstructions.

item.title: Cognitive Architectures for Language Agents
item.description: Recent efforts have incorporated large language models (LLMs) with external resources (e. g., the Internet) or internal control flows (e. g., prompt chaining) for tasks requiring grounding or reasoning.

item.title: ReliTalk: Relightable Talking Portrait Generation from a Single Video
item.description: Our key insight is to decompose the portrait's reflectance from implicitly learned audio-driven facial normals and images.

item.title: Robustness and Generalizability of Deepfake Detection: A Study with Diffusion Models
item.description: The rise of deepfake images, especially of well-known personalities, poses a serious threat to the dissemination of authentic information.

item.title: The Adversarial Implications of Variable-Time Inference
item.description: In our examination of the timing side-channel vulnerabilities associated with this algorithm, we identified the potential to enhance decision-based attacks.

item.title: Tensorization: Creating and Utilising Multidimensional Datasets for Multiway Analysis and Tensorised Deep Neural Networks -- Python Tutorial and Survey
item.description: As the size and complexity of data continue to increase, the need for efficient and effective analysis methods becomes ever more crucial.

item.title: Superclustering by finding statistically significant separable groups of optimal gaussian clusters
item.description: The paper presents the algorithm for clustering a dataset by grouping the optimal, from the point of view of the BIC criterion, number of Gaussian clusters into the optimal, from the point of view of their statistical separability, superclusters.

item.title: INCEPTNET: Precise And Early Disease Detection Application For Medical Images Analyses
item.description: In this study, we propose a novel deep neural network (DNN), entitled InceptNet, in the scope of medical image processing, for early disease detection and segmentation of medical images in order to enhance precision and performance.

item.title: UniSA: Unified Generative Framework for Sentiment Analysis
item.description: Sentiment analysis is a crucial task that aims to understand people’s emotional states and predict emotional categories based on multimodal information.

item.title: UniSA: Unified Generative Framework for Sentiment Analysis
item.description: Sentiment analysis is a crucial task that aims to understand people's emotional states and predict emotional categories based on multimodal information.

item.title: DAT++: Spatially Dynamic Vision Transformer with Deformable Attention
item.description: On the one hand, using dense attention in ViT leads to excessive memory and computational cost, and features can be influenced by irrelevant parts that are beyond the region of interests.

item.title: TSTTC: A Large-Scale Dataset for Time-to-Contact Estimation in Driving Scenarios
item.description: Time-to-Contact (TTC) estimation is a critical task for assessing collision risk and is widely used in various driver assistance and autonomous driving systems.

item.title: Relay Diffusion: Unifying diffusion process across resolutions for image synthesis
item.description: Diffusion models achieved great success in image synthesis, but still face challenges in high-resolution generation.

item.title: Are We Using Autoencoders in a Wrong Way?
item.description: Autoencoders are certainly among the most studied and used Deep Learning models: the idea behind them is to train a model in order to reconstruct the same input data.

item.title: Classic algorithms are fair learners: Classification Analysis of natural weather and wildfire occurrences
item.description: Classic machine learning algorithms have been reviewed and studied mathematically on its performance and properties in detail.

item.title: DeViL: Decoding Vision features into Language
item.description: We demonstrate that DeViL generates textual descriptions relevant to the image content on CC3M surpassing previous lightweight captioning models and attribution maps uncovering the learned concepts of the vision backbone.

item.title: COMEDIAN: Self-Supervised Learning and Knowledge Distillation for Action Spotting using Transformers
item.description: We present COMEDIAN, a novel pipeline to initialize spatio-temporal transformers for action spotting, which involves self-supervised learning and knowledge distillation.

item.title: Few shot font generation via transferring similarity guided global style and quantization local style
item.description: To better capture the local styles, a cross-attention-based style transfer module is adopted to transfer the styles of reference glyphs to the components, where the components are self-learned discrete latent codes through vector quantization without manual definition.

item.title: BLSP: Bootstrapping Language-Speech Pre-training via Behavior Alignment of Continuation Writing
item.description: One is a cascaded approach where outputs (tokens or states) of a separately trained speech recognition system are used as inputs for LLMs, which limits their potential in modeling alignment between speech and text.

item.title: BLSP: Bootstrapping Language-Speech Pre-training via Behavior Alignment of Continuation Writing
item.description: One is a cascaded approach where outputs (tokens or states) of a separately trained speech recognition system are used as inputs for LLMs, which limits their potential in modeling alignment between speech and text.

item.title: RevColV2: Exploring Disentangled Representations in Masked Image Modeling
item.description: Such design enables our architecture with the nice property: maintaining disentangled low-level and semantic information at the end of the network in MIM pre-training.

item.title: ObjectLab: Automated Diagnosis of Mislabeled Images in Object Detection Data
item.description: Despite powering sensitive systems like autonomous vehicles, object detection remains fairly brittle in part due to annotation errors that plague most real-world training datasets.

item.title: Zero-Shot Recommendations with Pre-Trained Large Language Models for Multimodal Nudging
item.description: We present a method for zero-shot recommendation of multimodal non-stationary content that leverages recent advancements in the field of generative AI.

item.title: FastPoseGait: A Toolbox and Benchmark for Efficient Pose-based Gait Recognition
item.description: Our toolbox supports a set of cutting-edge pose-based gait recognition algorithms and a variety of related benchmarks.

item.title: Tutorial: a priori estimation of sample size, effect size, and statistical power for cluster analysis, latent class analysis, and multivariate mixture models
item.description: The table shows the minimum numbers of observations per expected subgroup (sample size) and features (measured variables) to achieve acceptable statistical power, and can be readily used in study design.

item.title: NTU4DRadLM: 4D Radar-centric Multi-Modal Dataset for Localization and Mapping
item.description: 5) Considered both middle-and large-scale outdoor environments , i. e., the 6 trajectories range from 246m to 6. 95km.

item.title: Interpretation of High-Dimensional Linear Regression: Effects of Nullspace and Regularization Demonstrated on Battery Data
item.description: We developed an optimization formulation to compare regression coefficients and coefficients obtained by physical engineering knowledge to understand which part of the coefficient differences are close to the nullspace.

item.title: Point-Bind & Point-LLM: Aligning Point Cloud with Multi-modality for 3D Understanding, Generation, and Instruction Following
item.description: We introduce Point-Bind, a 3D multi-modality model aligning point clouds with 2D image, language, audio, and video.

item.title: SparseSat-NeRF: Dense Depth Supervised Neural Radiance Fields for Sparse Satellite Images
item.description: However, NeRF and its variants require many views to produce convincing scene's geometries which in earth observation satellite imaging is rare.

item.title: A Theoretical and Practical Framework for Evaluating Uncertainty Calibration in Object Detection
item.description: The proliferation of Deep Neural Networks has resulted in machine learning systems becoming increasingly more present in various real-world applications.

item.title: A Text-based Approach For Link Prediction on Wikipedia Articles
item.description: This paper present our work in the DSAA 2023 Challenge about Link Prediction for Wikipedia Articles.

item.title: Let the Models Respond: Interpreting Language Model Detoxification Through the Lens of Prompt Dependence
item.description: Due to language models' propensity to generate toxic or hateful responses, several techniques were developed to align model generations with users' preferences.

item.title: Patent image retrieval using transformer-based deep metric learning
item.description: Intellectual property work covers a wide range of areas.
